pullrequest.title: Added an IndexedMzML class to make random access of indexed MzML documents possible.

content.raw:
If 1 is simple enough, I think it's preferable. On the other hand, 2 is kind of already the case, because we have `read()` and it's not going away. With two different indexed classes in `mzml.py`, I guess we'll have to use some kwargs in `mzml.read` anyway.
I think I'd rather keep the original implementation, mostly because it's "cleaner" (as in, doesn't parse XML with regex).

I see that you have already added the `use_index` flag. Does that mean we only have to copy the methods over to `XML` and we are done?
content.html:
If 1 is simple enough, I think it's preferable. On the other hand, 2 is kind of already the case, because we have read() and it's not going away. With two different indexed classes in mzml.py, I guess we'll have to use some kwargs in mzml.read anyway. I think I'd rather keep the original implementation, mostly because it's "cleaner" (as in, doesn't parse XML with regex).

I see that you have already added the use_index flag. Does that mean we only have to copy the methods over to XML and we are done?
